title: Hot gas temperature after electric field turns off

content.prompt: The electric field is now turned off, and the gas is allowed to reach a final equilibrium temperature T2. How does T2 compare to T1, and why?

choices.label: T2 is less, because the electric potential energy added by the field to separate the ions is gone once the field is turned off.
T2 is less, because pairs of positive and negative ions bond to become molecules once the field is turned off, and energy is required to create the bonds.
T2 is greater, because work is done on the ions in the process of turning off the field.
T2 is greater, because the electric potential energy of the separated ions is converted to kinetic energy as they mix and collide.
